class Controller

Bases: object

The singleton thing which is the top-level Application.

It is responsible for owning the Model data and the Views, and orchestrating event messages to each if the Model/View change.

Bases: cara.apps.expert.Controller

notify_model_values_changed()

Occurs when any value in any of the scenarios has been modified.

notify_scenarios_changed()

Occurs when the set of scenarios has been modified, but not if the values of the scenario has changed.

Called when a scenario is added/removed/renamed etc.

Note: Not called when the model state is modified.

ScenarioType

A scenario is a name and a (mutable) model.

alias of Tuple[str, cara.state.DataclassState]

class View

Bases: object

A thing which exposes a .widget attribute which is a view on some data. This view is essentially a complex combination of widgets, along with some event handling capabilities, which may or may not be sent back up to the underlying controller.

We strive hard to keep “Model” data out of the View (and try to avoid storing it at all on the View itself), instead relying on being able to notify, and receive notifications, of important events from the Controller.
